messages: d82591cb60e7235a0e396d1edf4638e9 (03:00): anyone have a method for targeting css specifically at safari (not chrome)
d82591cb60e7235a0e396d1edf4638e9 (03:00): safari's lack of support for small-caps in web fonts is shitting on my parade
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (03:12): d82591cb60e7235a0e396d1edf4638e9: and chrome supports that?
d82591cb60e7235a0e396d1edf4638e9 (03:13): yeah it's working correctly which surprised me
d82591cb60e7235a0e396d1edf4638e9 (03:13): using Myriad Pro Confensed from typekit
d82591cb60e7235a0e396d1edf4638e9 (03:19): yeah all the ones I could find don't seem to apply to Safari 5
d82591cb60e7235a0e396d1edf4638e9 (03:19): I guess I could just do a test for font-variant
d82591cb60e7235a0e396d1edf4638e9 (03:20): by comparing widths of an element, cause it'll go to the fallback font and be a different width
d82591cb60e7235a0e396d1edf4638e9 (03:20): relying on js anyway for the font embedding to begin with
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (03:20): omg.... DHTML Dude. http://msdn.microsoft.com/en-us/library/bb263969%28v=VS.85%29.aspx
d82591cb60e7235a0e396d1edf4638e9 (03:20): hahaha wtf is this
d82591cb60e7235a0e396d1edf4638e9 (03:21): a person wrote this
d82591cb60e7235a0e396d1edf4638e9 (03:21): a real person
d82591cb60e7235a0e396d1edf4638e9 (03:22): bam http://dmassy.wordpress.com/
d82591cb60e7235a0e396d1edf4638e9 (03:22): there he is
d82591cb60e7235a0e396d1edf4638e9 (03:22): works on windows embedded, thankfully not touching javascript anymore
e02bd40f5c8fe41d28e4b72550a8bdd5 (03:28): Is there still no way, even planned, for doing dashed/dotten paths?

d82591cb60e7235a0e396d1edf4638e9 (03:42): best I could for the moment on targeting safari is relying on modernizr and doing this @media screen and (-webkit-min-device-pixel-ratio:0) { .no-webgl #element { color: red; } }
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (03:44): 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049, yo i have no clue what are you talking about
38e5971429bb0f30aa410ac1ae0bb9a9 (03:44): (43 hours 2 mins ago) <nimbupani> tell 4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 wooot! thnxxx
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (03:45): ?tell nimbupani np
38e5971429bb0f30aa410ac1ae0bb9a9 (03:45): 4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596, Okay.
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (03:47): d82591cb60e7235a0e396d1edf4638e9: can you pastie the @font-face stuff you're using? oh nvm its typekit..
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (03:48): i think you'll have to UA sniff. use cssagent.js
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (03:54): ?tell nimbupani i want to publish jshint site on thursday, do you think you could help me with css on wednesday?
38e5971429bb0f30aa410ac1ae0bb9a9 (03:54): 4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596, Okay.
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (03:55): 4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049: I've never used modernizer but I have a question
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (03:55): say I want to use border-radius
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (03:55): 4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596: today is wednesday
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (03:55): currently it works for ff and chrome
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (03:56): using modernizer will it work in ie7 and 8?
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (03:56): modernizr currently only *detects* native support
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (03:56): so what's the point of modenizer?
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (03:57): what does it do then if I can't apply ie to older browsers
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (03:57): i mean apply to IE
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (03:57): well lets say that you wanted the corners to be rounded for oldIE..
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (03:57): .no-borderradius .rounded { background: url(rounded.png); }
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (03:58): so you conditionally use a background image for browsers without native support.
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (03:58): whereas the rest can do it natively in css.
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (03:58): hmm I see.
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (03:59): I might as well used the rounded version for all then, don't you think
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (03:59): ?
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (03:59): aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d: whatcha mean
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (03:59): I mean, rather than create a conditional
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (03:59): knowing rounded.png version will work for all
4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596 (03:59): ?tell nimbupani i just realized that wednesday is today, then thursday morning? :)
38e5971429bb0f30aa410ac1ae0bb9a9 (03:59): 4a722ba9665fe3ebecdfcf04168ae596, Okay.
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (04:00): then having multiple rules
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (04:00): for an older browser
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (04:00): but I do understand the idea behind that.
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (04:00): aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d: but that means you're going to send a 30kb image to all browsers.. even though 60% of them dont need it?
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (04:00): good point.
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (04:01): so that's kinda the idea
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (04:01): good browsers use the native feature
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (04:01): older ones.. you provide a less-perfect solution to.
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (04:02): right
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (04:02): css3pie automates the common cases for you
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (04:02): and that's kinda okay
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (04:02): what do you 'automates' ?
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (04:03): what will it 'do' for you
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (04:03): css3pie does rounded corners and box shadow and gradients if there isnt native support
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (04:04): um... is css3pie part of modenizer or seperate
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (04:04): ?
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (04:04): it uses VML and some tricky stuff.. sometimes you might want to handle something differently though
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (04:04): so css3pie will automatically create a png or gif that's rounded?

4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (04:05): @font-face is another good one.. if there isn't support.. (ff3.0) then you probably want to change font sizes because the fallback font has different size metrics thant he webfont you're loading

4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (04:05): or in the logo of http://html5rocks.com its a white 5 with a grey text-shadow.. in ie6-9, there is no text-shadow support.. so we catch that and make the whole 5 gray
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (04:07): css3pie will automatically create a png or gif that's rounded?
d82591cb60e7235a0e396d1edf4638e9 (04:07): it creates stuff using vml
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (04:08): oh ok, not sure what that is.. but ok
d82591cb60e7235a0e396d1edf4638e9 (04:08): it's kind of like a shitty version of svg
d82591cb60e7235a0e396d1edf4638e9 (04:08): vector graphics, drawn by javascript
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (04:08): it's black magic, pretty much. also that ^
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (04:09): gotcha
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (04:09): thx for the input on that so far
d82591cb60e7235a0e396d1edf4638e9 (04:09): so basically it mimics the native browser drawing by doing the drawing with svg
d82591cb60e7235a0e396d1edf4638e9 (04:09): and css3pie does a damn good job of it for the stuff it supports
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (04:10): you know what, @font-face is good but there's one thing I'm not a fan of
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (04:10): and this is just my opinion obviously
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (04:10): it looks wierd, there's no smoothing
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (04:11): and sometimes I find it hard to read
d82591cb60e7235a0e396d1edf4638e9 (04:11): that depends on a lot of factors, a really lot lot
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (04:11): versus a generic font like Arial
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (04:11): i'm on Win7
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (04:11): which is the majority
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (04:11): yeah.. there are a lot of quality issues with some webfonts.
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (04:11): some are better than others.. its all up to the font itself.. nothing to do with the technology persay
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (04:11): that's what I'm no fan of, and I'm hoping they'll improve on that
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (04:12): and I know on Macs and it's beautiful and crisp
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (04:12): but gotta think about window guys
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (04:12): oh I see..
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (04:12): which browser you talking about
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (04:12): IE8
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (04:12): ff12 and ie9 should look much better than ff3.6

d82591cb60e7235a0e396d1edf4638e9 (04:12): what you really want to mostly do is use fonts that have specifically been rejiggered for the web. Like if you go to http://typekit.com and click on the "paragraph" tag on the bottom right
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (04:12): i'm not touching ie9 until it's final
d82591cb60e7235a0e396d1edf4638e9 (04:12): all those have been rekerned and reawesomed for the web
d82591cb60e7235a0e396d1edf4638e9 (04:13): some other ones look ok but those will definitely work
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (04:13): aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d: check out the same pages in ie9 RC.. they'll look a lot better
d82591cb60e7235a0e396d1edf4638e9 (04:13): er Browse Fonts, then the paragraph tag
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (04:13): alright, I'll wait till final is out but if improved on ie9 that's good then
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (04:13): will check that out d82591cb60e7235a0e396d1edf4638e9
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (04:15): curious, if you're on a MAC how do you test on windows?
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (04:15): unless you have a physical pc next to you
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (04:15): diff story

d82591cb60e7235a0e396d1edf4638e9 (04:16): for your edification on web fonts I suggest these two articles: http://blog.typekit.com/2010/12/17/type-rendering-review-and-fonts-that-render-well/ http://blog.typekit.com/2011/01/26/css-properties-that-affect-type-rendering/
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (04:16): like MAC FF vs Win FF
d82591cb60e7235a0e396d1edf4638e9 (04:16): web fonts can look great but it takes some work to make sure
aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d (04:17): cool good stuff
4c681049601b3c374f1d2c0077c99049 (04:18): aa0abd9d7e35cef4b0e2802cc422bd4d: i use virtual box with an xp image and a win7 image
